Uses of IColor in colors
 

Classes in colors that implement IColor
 class Color
          This class represents a RGB color.
 

Methods in colors that return IColor
 IColor IColor.addColor(IColor otherColor)
          Adds the color (values) to another color (values) and returns the result color (not changing the current color).
 IColor Color.addColor(IColor otherColor)
          Adds the color (values) to another color (values) and returns the result color (not changing the current color).
static IColor Color.getAverageColor(IColor[][] colorMatrix)
          Returns a color whose values are the average of the given colors.
 IColor IColor.multiplyByColor(IColor otherColor)
          Multiplies the color (values) by another color (values) and returns the result color (not changing the current color).
 IColor Color.multiplyByColor(IColor otherColor)
          Multiplies the color (values) by another color (values) and returns the result color (not changing the current color).
 IColor IColor.multiplyByConstant(double c)
          Multiplies the color (values) by a constant scalar (not changing the current color).
 IColor Color.multiplyByConstant(double c)
          Multiplies the color (values) by a constant scalar (not changing the current color).

Methods in scene that return IColor
 IColor Scene.getAmbientLightIntensity()
          Returns the ambient light intensity of the scene.
 IColor Scene.getBackgroundColor()
          Returns the background color (not considering the background texture).
 IColor Scene.getBackgroundColor(double x, double y)
          Returns the background color (considering the background texture).
 IColor Scene.getColor(double x, double y)
          Returns the color for pixel at coordinates (x,y) (after doing the the ray tracing).
 IColor Scene.getColorWithSuperSample(double x, double y)
          Returns the color for pixel at coordinates (x,y) with super sampling (after doing the the ray tracing).
